headline.seo: The Banality of ‘Don’t Be Evil’ by Julian Assange
headline.main: The Banality of ‘Don’t Be Evil’
headline.print_headline: The Banality of ‘Don’t Be Evil’

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by WikiLeaks editor in chief Julian Assange contends book The New Digital Age by Eric Schmidt and Jared Cohen is a startlingly clear and provocative blueprint for technocratic imperialism, proselytizing role of technology in reshaping world; warns that digital technologies are not liberating the world, but are instead imprisoning it.

headline.main: U.S. Confirms That It Gathers Online Data Overseas
headline.sub: Officials Defend Two Secret Programs as Authorized by Law
headline.print_headline: U.S. Confirms Gathering of Web Data Overseas

docs.abstract: James Clapper, director of national intelligence, confirms that federal government has been secretly collecting information on foreigners overseas for nearly six years from nation's largest Internet companies like Google, Facebook and Apple, in search of national security threats; confirmation comes hours after officials acknowledged separate seven-year effort by National Security Agency to sweep up Verizon records of telephone calls inside United States.

headline.main: Fact Finder to European Court Backs Google in a Spanish Privacy Battle
headline.print_headline: Fact Finder to European Court Backs Google in a Spanish Privacy Battle

docs.abstract: European Union's highest court, in victory for Google, receives recommendation to strike down Spanish regulator's demand that search engine grant citizens broad rights to remove public records from search results; recommendation by court's advocate general, Niilo Jaaskinen, who acted as official fact finder of panel, could inform debate in European Parliament over updating 1995 data protection law.
